Contents: im not super familiar with all the options, I would experiment a bit with it to get more comfortable with using the add-on
and then there are different actions you can take with the add-on through a drop down menu
so to use the add-on, you copy and paste your article
yah, pretty much cards are just your evidence
do you know what it means to cut cards ?

i know thats prolly sound supppppper vague and confusing but if you want more info on cutting cards or how the add on works feel free to ask me (or i bet someone like charissa would love to help and would prolly know a bunch more than me lol)

so basically, how i've been using the add on is for cutting cards - i dont know if you were here at our last LD meeting but basically cards are just pieces of evidence and you find articles and you highlight the parts you want to read during an argument and underline like more important stuff. the parts of the add ons that ive been using are "clear" : which makes sure the article is all the same format, "condense" which takes the entire article and puts it into one huge chunk of text and "shrink" which shirnks everything that isn't underlined and keeps everything underlined the same size
Hi Valdy, this is Emily (from debate - i didnt want to spam the whole server about the google docs add on for debate)
